definition: George Bernard Shaw (1856-1950), Irish dramatist and writer
father's elder brother/senior/paternal elder uncle/eldest of brothers/respectful form of address/Count, third of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]
to receive/to accept/to enjoy/to bring into/to pay (tax etc)/nano- (one billionth)/to reinforce sole of shoes or stockings by close sewing

sentences.english: This book is suffused with Shaw's characteristic wry Irish humour.
sentences.chinese: 这本书充满了萧伯纳独特的爱尔兰式幽默与嘲讽。

sentences.english: George Bernard Shaw is pictured with Lu Xun, the father of modern Chinese fiction, in 1933.
sentences.chinese: 有1933年萧伯纳和中国现代小说之父鲁迅合影。

sentences.english: Much of Shavian drama is constructed around the inversion of a conventional theatrical situation.
sentences.chinese: 萧伯纳戏剧的大部分总是围绕着对传统剧情的反演。

sentences.english: He liked journeying forth to his office.
sentences.chinese: 萧伯纳喜欢径直走到他的办公室。

sentences.english: He launched into endless anecdotes about Shaw.
sentences.chinese: 他开始滔滔不绝地讲起萧伯纳的轶事。

definition: Mark Twain (Samuel Langhorne Clemens 1835-1910), US writer, novelist and humorist, author of Adventures of Huckleberry Finn 哈克貝利·芬歷險記|哈克贝利·芬历险记[Ha1 ke4 bei4 li4 · Fen1 Li4 xian3 Ji4]
Tolstoy (name)/Count Lev Nikolayevich Tostoy (1828-1910), great Russian novelist, author of War and Peace 戰爭與和平|战争与和平
Honoré de Balzac (1799-1850), French novelist, author of series La comédie humaine
Anton Pavlovich Chekhov (1860-1904), Russian writer famous for his short stories and plays
Gustave Flaubert (1821-1880), French realist novelist, author of Madame Bovary
Henrik Ibsen (1828-1906), Norwegian dramatist, author of Doll's House 玩偶之家
Tolstoy (name)/Count Lev Nikolayevich Tostoy (1828-1910), great Russian novelist, author of War and Peace 戰爭與和平|战争与和平
pinyin: Lie4 fu1 · Tuo1 er3 si1 tai4

definition: Shakespeare/slang or popular culture abbr. of 莎士比亞|莎士比亚[Sha1 shi4 bi3 ya4]
